channel.title: Blogs on Indalit Cloud Consulting
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Indalit Cloud Consulting

item.title: Business Plan
item.description: My Business Plan Like any serious future business owner, one does a business plan. This may seem like a small thing, but it’s a crazy document to complete, which makes you write a bunch of other documents/excel sheets. You also need to do a market research which I honestly have been ignoring. But if you do all that correctly, then your business is sure to thrive. Once you have finished the business plan, all you need to do is push “PLAY” and it all happens because everything is ready to go.

item.title: AWS Security Groups Associated to Network Interfaces
item.description: Did you know AWS Security Groups are associated with a network interface? This means you can have different Security Groups on each network interface.

item.title: AWS Security Groups Inbound & Outbound Traffic
item.description: Did you know AWS Security Groups are stateful for outbound AND inbound traffic?

item.title: Industrialized Versus Homemade
item.description: Ugliness After working on the website for over a week, maybe even two, I can’t help but find it just doesn’t have the right look. I’ve redone the packs page/pages a few times and I’m still not happy with them. I know I will have to continue working on them tomorrow. The homepage template is great, perfectly corporate, but the images in the carousel and the formatting of the text just don’t cut it.

item.title: Can't Imagine the Goal
item.description: I’m continuing to be a web developer, graphic designer and writer. I’m definitely better at HTML and CSS, but not the design and content part. So I’ve decided to accept the not so perfect pages, they may not look top notch professional but they will do the job. In the end, what will matter is the service we give and not the design of our web site. As for content, I guess “INTERNET” will need to deal with the more direct approach and finally give up on all the bullshit keywords and phrases.

item.title: New Indalit Logo
item.description:
We have a new logo. It’s actually just an update, but it’s still a new logo.
While we are on the subjet, let us explain the meaning of our logo. It actually comes from something and wasn’t just created from nothing, it has a meaning. And yes, the cloud is part of the source and has not been added to match the services we offer. Wikipedia will explain it better than I will, Indalo story on Wikipedia.

item.title: How To Make A Template for BLOG Posts
item.description: How Does It Work Now? When you create a BLOG post, you can use a template file you have created with all the possible TAGS and CATEGORIES (for example), there might be a better way to handle this with Hugo, but I haven’t even looked. This post is not about creating a template for all BLOG posts, but only for a certain type of BLOG posts. If you want a specific HTML formatting for only specific types of BLOG posts, then you need to add it to your template file.

item.title: AWS Services List
item.description: Amazon EC2 Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling Amazon EC2 Container Service (ECS) AWS Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes AWS Fargate AWS Serverless Application Repository AWS Elastic Beanstalk Amazon EC2 Container Registry Amazon Lightsail AWS Batch AWS Lambda Amazon S3 Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) AWS Storage Gateway AWS Snowball Edge Amazon EBS Amazon Glacier AWS Snowball AWS Snowmobile Amazon Aurora Amazon DynamoDB Amazon ElastiCache AWS Database Migration Service Amazon RDS Amazon Neptune

item.title: AWS CloudFront Migration to HTTPS with Errors
item.description: I need to start this by saying there is NO bug with AWS CloudFront, NO bug with AWS S3, NO bug with Hugo and NO bug with OWL Carousel javascript. This is a Veronique bug. I just wanted to document this in case someone has a similar problem. I was unable to find the solution on the internet with the search strings I used. Environment Hugo Static Website Generator version v0.

item.title: AWS DynamoDB Replication
item.description: Did you know AWS DynamoDB provides you with a fully managed, multi-region, and multi-master database? Your tables can be automatically replicated across regions.

item.title: AWS Aurora Multi Master Multi AZ
item.description: Did you know that with Amazon Aurora you can have multiple master EC2 Instances across multiple AZ?

item.title: How Things Change
item.description: It’s time for another update. I’m still a web developer for now, it’s taking much more time than planned. The good news is yesterday I sat down and started to write HTML with nested DIVS and formatting all over the place without any hesitation, just came out like I’ve been doing it for some time. I know this won’t last, when I’m done, it will go away as fast as it came, but I’m proud of myself.

item.title: Amazon EBS Volumes Delete on Instance Termination
item.description: Did you know that by default Amazon Web Services EBS root device volumes are automatically deleted when the instance terminates? This is also the case with ephemeral storage (instance store volumes). Other non root EBS volumes are not deleted. You can configure your instance so it doesn’t delete the EBS root device volumes with the DeleteOnTermination attribute.

item.title: Debugging www.indalit.com
item.description: On my previous post I was working on www.indalit.com. First of all, I, innocent me, actually thought I was finished. But then, I made the mistake at looking at the page with my mobile phone!!! And then making my browser screen smaller!!! Wow, horrible. So, it turns out working with CSS and positioning correctly DIVs is just not a beginners thing. Took me hours of work. Now it works great, but my associate has decided it needs to be centered.

item.title: Bug Report - Hugo(Universal Theme) - in BLOG Image Loading Intermittent
item.description: Environment Hugo Static Website Generator version v0.36 Hugo Universal Theme Hosted on AWS S3 in http only Image size as per examples : 1000 x 750 .js and .css files have not been modified What should be happening When going on the BLOG page, a list of most recent blog post will appear one after the other with the associated image on the left. What is happening When going on the BLOG page, a list of most recent blog post will appear one after the other with or without the image on the left.

item.title: AWS VPC To Span Across AZs
item.description: Did you know that a subnet cannot span multiple AWS Availability Zones while a VPC can?

item.title: Creating the Packs Web Page
item.description: As you probably don't know, I am creating/making/writing/configuring www.indalit.com using an open source static site generator called Hugo. I've chosen a theme and moved forward from that. The small glitch is I'm am NOT a web developer at all. I've learned Python for fun and mostly forgot since I haven't been practicing, but that's all my experience in the development world. So working on this site has been a great challenge for me; Hugo provides a theme, but that's just the base and after that you have a lot of modifications to do.

item.title: AWS Storage Gateway Cheat Sheet
item.description: General Characteristics 3 types of gateways available(NFS or iSCSI): - File Gateway - Volume Gateway - Tape Gateway You install the Gateways with a provided image on a on-premises server VM. Also possible on an instance. VM software is either VMware ESXi or Microsoft Hyper-V. Objects on S3 are encrypted using S3 SSE-S3 (S3 managed encryption keys).

item.title: AWS Has Launched a New General Purpose Instance Family, M5
item.description: Did you know AWS EC2 has a new General Purpose instance family, M5? Check if available in your region.

item.title: AWS Launches Amazon GuardDuty
item.description: Did you know AWS launched Amazon GuardDuty? This is a threat detection service which analyses events from AWS CloudTrail, VPC Flow Logs and more.

item.title: AWS Launches Fargate, Containers without EC2 Instances
item.description: Did you know Amazon launched AWS Fargate? The new AWS Fagate service allows for deployment and management of containers without having to build a cluster of EC2 Instances.

item.title: AWS Aurora Relational Database in the Cloud
item.description: Did you know Amazon Aurora will enable you to run your Relational Database in the Cloud without managing any instances or clusters?

item.title: AWS Cross Region VPC Peering
item.description: Did you know AWS now allows VPC Peering across different regions?

item.title: AWS Introduces Spread Placement Groups
item.description: Did you know AWS introduced Spread Placement Groups? This means AWS EC2 Instances within a Placement Group will be on distinct hardware.

item.title: AWS Lightsail Launches Load Balancing Support
item.description: Did you know Amazon Lightsail has added support for Load Balancers with integrated certificate management?

item.title: AWS Glacier Expedite Retrieval Options
item.description: Did you know you have two options when choosing Expedited Retrieval on AWS Glacier? You can choose on-demand or provisioned.

item.title: AWS Spot Intances Bid Duration
item.description: Did you know you can also bid for AWS SPOT Instances for a duration of 1 or 6 hours? This guarantees a minimum uptime for your instances. Of course the price is different.

item.title: AWS New Compute Optimized Instance Family - C5
item.description: Did you know AWS EC2 has a new Compute Optimized instance family, C5? Check if available in your region.

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances Per Second Billing
item.description: Did you know the new AWS per second billing of AWS EC2 instances is only for Linux instances?

item.title: A Sort of Personal Blog
item.description: Yes, it’s official, we are starting the process of creating our company. I assume this will take a few months, but I am not in a hurry. At this stage roles are not clear, so I go with the flow. For now, I seem responsible for the design/creation and configuration of our website Indalit.com and it’s content. So, I decided on having a blog. Inicially thinking it will look professional, be a good place to publish what I write about AWS and help with SEO.

item.title: AWS EC2 EBS Encryption of Boot Volume
item.description: Did you know the Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) boot volume can be encrypted?

item.title: AWS S3 Encryption SSE-C
item.description: Did you know Amazon S3 SSE-C means Server Side Encryption with Customer-Provided Keys?

item.title: AWS Deleting the Queue After 30 Days
item.description: Did you know if an AWS SQS queue does not receive certain requests for more than 30 days, AWS reserves the right to delete the queue?

item.title: AWS RDS Multi Availability Zone Deployment
item.description: Did you know with an Amazone RDS Multi-AZ deployment, the standby cannot be used for read or write operations?

item.title: AWS EC2 Ephemeral Storage
item.description: Did you know when an Amazon EC2 instance with ephemeral store volumes is stopped, the data is lost?

item.title: AWS RDS Database Read Replicas
item.description: Did you know that with Amazon RDS you can create Read Replicas from an another Read Replica and have the replication handled between them? This reduces the load on the master.

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances T2 VPC
item.description: Did you know you cannot launch an AWS T2 instance type in an AWS EC2-Classic platform? You must launch it in a VPC.

item.title: AWS Glacier Expedite
item.description: Did you know there is an option to expedite the retrieval of an Amazon Glacier archive within minutes?

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances Public IP
item.description: Did you know an Amazon EC2 Instance retains its private IP addresses when it is stopped? This is not the case for the public IP address which is released when the instance is stopped.

item.title: AWS EC2 Intances Metadata
item.description: Did you know that viewing the following link on an AWS EC2 Instance will give you the metadata of your instance? http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/

item.title: AWS Glacier Minimum Pricing
item.description: Did you know if you delete an archive from Amazon Glacier less than 90 days after it was uploaded you will still pay 90 days of storage for it?

item.title: AWS Auto Scaling Cooldown Period
item.description: Did you know the default AWS Auto Scaling cooldown period is 300 seconds? When AWS Auto Scaling launches a new instance, it will wait 300 seconds before launching a new one.

item.title: AWS Auto Scaling Termination Policy
item.description: Did you know when you use the default termination policy with AWS Auto Scaling it doesn’t terminate the instance with the oldest launch configuration automatically? It first tries to balance the number of instances across Availability Zones, then picks the Availability Zone with the most instances and terminates the instance with the oldest launch configuration. If there are more than one, then it ends the process by randomly picking the instance to terminate.
